thread.title: Alabama Homecoming 2015: Choreography Contest draws big crowd, sweet moves in Coleman Coliseum
thread.title_full: Alabama Homecoming 2015: Choreography Contest draws big crowd, sweet moves in Coleman Coliseum

author: Ben Flanagan | bflanagan@al.com
title: Alabama Homecoming 2015: Choreography Contest draws big crowd, sweet moves in Coleman Coliseum
text:
Comments 
TUSCALOOSA, Alabama -- University of Alabama homecoming week continued Thursday night with the annual Choreography Competition in which student organizations danced the night away in Coleman Coliseum. 
Participants had a week to prepare a choreographed dance number based on the provided theme of movie soundtracks. 
Alabama gymnastics head coach Dana Duckworth served as emcee, while the Crimson Cabaret and campus hip hop troupe Rip Tide Dance Crew performed special numbers. 
First place went to "The Riot," while second place went to "Nicest Kids in Town" and third place to "The JungleCats." 
See photos from the event above, and watch numbers tweeted by the official UA Homecoming account below. Riot dancing to the soundtrack of Furious 7! pic.twitter.com/Eag9BDF6KF — UA Homecoming (@UAHomecoming) October 9, 2015 The Nicest Kids in Town perform to Hairspray! pic.twitter.com/ZLtPcaiShv — UA Homecoming (@UAHomecoming) October 8, 2015 JungleCats dance to music from Glee! pic.twitter.com/LKNs1FAfrE
